title: The Complete Guide To The DIALOG Information Network
historical_context: This article was published during a time when online databases were becoming increasingly important for research and information retrieval, particularly before the widespread adoption of the internet.
target_audience: Hackers, researchers, security professionals, and anyone interested in online information retrieval.
short_summary: This article provides a comprehensive overview of the DIALOG Information Network, detailing its access methods, various databases available, and tips for effective searching. It highlights the importance of online databases for research and personal education.
summary:
In 'The Complete Guide To The DIALOG Information Network', Brian Oblivion explores the functionalities and benefits of the DIALOG service, which connects numerous public and commercial databases for easier access. The article emphasizes the significance of these databases, which contain vast amounts of information relevant to personal lives and various fields of study. Oblivion lists several notable databases available through DIALOG, such as McGraw-Hill Publications and PR Newswire, illustrating the breadth of information accessible to users. He also provides practical advice on how to navigate the DIALOG system, including logon procedures and search commands, making it easier for users to extract valuable data efficiently.

The guide serves as a resource for anyone looking to leverage the power of online databases for research or corporate intelligence. Oblivion's insights into the DIALOG Information Network not only highlight its utility but also underscore the necessity of mastering such tools in an era where information is both abundant and essential for academic and professional success. The article remains relevant as it reflects the early days of online information retrieval, a precursor to today's internet-based research methodologies.
